page.title: 13THE POLICE IN WARMINSTER
page.content: 42 Police (39 men, 3 women) are based at Warminster Police Station, built in 1932. Most of them joined at 18\, and after training they can serve for up to 30 years. The local force has grown so much that former Police Houses have been turned into Offices. Crime in the area is increasing, with up to 452 crimes in one 5-month period. Chief Inspector Oram says the biggest local crime problem is burglary, especially thefts from cars at beauty spots like Cley Hill.On evenings from Thursday to Saturday, pubs are open later, so more people get drunk and there are fights and car accidents, sometimes fatal. There were 4 local murders in 1984, usually due to family quarrels. The most serious recent crime in the town was an IRA bomb planted under a car, and intended to kill soldiers; luckily it was found and defused.
